Name: reeled raw silk hank production | reeled raw silk hank | EN15804GD, U
Category: C:Manufacturing/13:Manufacture of textiles/131:Spinning, weaving and finishing of textiles/1311:Preparation and spinning of textile fibres
Description: The following processes are used to process cocoons into raw silk: Oven drying,  cooking and reeling and winding. These processes take in cocoons  and heat them in oven for  6-7 hours, cooked in hot water. The cocoons are reeled in 10 basin Silk reeling machine. The reeled silk thus obtained is rereeled to form a standard hank of 70 g.
